title: Sphalerite
description: A beautiful mineral with a stunning luster and deep color variations.

title: Wollastonite
description: A beautiful mineral with a stunning luster and deep color variations.

title: K-Feldspar
description: A beautiful mineral with a stunning luster and deep color variations.

title: Calcite
description: A beautiful mineral with a stunning luster and deep color variations.

title: Quartz
description: A very common silicate mineral found in a variety of rock types. It is hard, transparent to opaque, and comes in many colors, including clear, pink (rose quartz), and purple (amethyst).

title: Tourmaline
description: Crystalline silicate material mainly composed of aluminium, iron, magnesium, sodium, lithium, or potassium. Known for its wide range of colors, it can appear as virtually every hue in the rainbow.

title: Magnesite
description: A magnesium carbonate mineral that is typically white or gray. It is used as a source of magnesium and in refractory materials.

title: Pyrite
description: An iron sulfide mineral with a metallic luster and golden-yellow color, often called 'fool's gold.' It forms in a variety of environments.

title: Ilmenite
description: An iron titanium oxide mineral that is black with a metallic to submetallic luster. It is an important source of titanium.

title: Rutile
description: A titanium dioxide mineral that is often reddish-brown or black. It is a major source of titanium and is used in pigments and coatings.

title: Tremolite
description: Monoclinic calcic amphibole, exhibits a vitreous luster and white streaks. Used commercially as asbestos. Handle with care

title: Siderite
description: Iron carbonate mineral, brownish to yellowish color. Serves as an iron ore and is commonly found in sedimentary and hydrothermal environments.

title: Hornblende
description: Dark-colored, complex silicate mineral of the amphibole group, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks. Commonly black/green in color.

title: Sulfur
description: Bright yellow, nonmetallic element that occurs in native form or in sulfide and sulfate minerals. Utilized in fertilizers and industrial chemicals.
